item.title: Helldivers 2 And Killzone Crossover Seemingly Leaked
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/helldivers-2-and-killzone-crossover-seemingly-leaked/1100-6528503/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A crossover between Helldivers 2 and the Killzone franchise has seemingly been leaked, potentially featuring new armor and weapons.

According to Twitter user Iron_S1ghts, the crossover is reportedly called Righteous Revenants Warbond. The user has been datamining the game for months on end, and has previously leaked the designs of the new enemy faction, the Illuminate. There are two screenshots floating around showing some of the alleged armors. They have Killzone's iconic gas masks and red eyes that give them their signature sinister look.

One of them is called AC-1 Dutiful and its passive ability provides 50% resistance to fire, gas, acid, and electrical damage. The other one is called AC-2 Obedient, which has the same passive ability, but offers less protectional in exchange for more speed and stamina recovery. Sony has not made any official announcement yet.

Arrowhead Studios said earlier this year that it'd be open to crossovers but "only if they make sense." Given that Helldivers 2 and Killzone both have fascist themes, this particular crossover seems like a great match. Another potential match could be between Helldivers 2 and Halo, but Arrowhead CEO Johan Pilestedt said that it would probably never happen.

Helldivers 2 recently added a new faction called the Illuminate, and players have crushed them in under a week. A limited-edition Helldivers 2 DualSense controller will also be available for preorder starting December 20. The game won Best Ongoing Game and Best Multiplayer at The Game Awards 2024.

item.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio's Massive Official Strategy Guide Up For Preorder At Amazon
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/metaphor-refantazios-massive-official-strategy-guide-up-for-preorder-at-amazon/1100-6528507/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Metaphor: ReFantazio is getting an official strategy guide on February 28, 2025, and you can preorder it now at Amazon for $55. Published by Future Press, the Metaphor: ReFantazio Strategy Guide is a 592-page hardcover book featuring mountains of information and full-color images "that recaptures Atlus's wonderfully unique style on the printed page," according to the Amazon listing.

Official strategy guides are uncommon these days, and this is the first one for an Atlus game in quite some time. Considering the popularity of Metaphor and Atlus role-playing games in general, we imagine this could sell out, so you may want to secure your preorder soon. Future Press has a great track record for making beautiful strategy guides, including a trio of Elden Ring strategy guides that are finally back in stock at Amazon. You can check out a list of notable Future Press guidebooks at the bottom of this story.

Metaphor: ReFantazio Official Strategy Guide (Hardcover)

$55 | Releases February 28, 2025

Metaphor: ReFantazio's massive official strategy guide sounds like both an awesome collectible for Atlus fans and a comprehensive compendium of everything you could possibly want to know about the game.

Along with a complete walkthrough designed so that you see and do everything, the guidebook has multiple catalogs of useful information to pore over:

  • Archetype Encyclopedia: An exhaustive section covering all skills, Synthesis attacks, and inheritance options.
  • Equipment catalog: All items and equipment are included in a section designed to be used as a quick reference sheet.
  • Bestiary: Every enemy in the game is chronicled with in-depth stats, including strengths and weaknesses, item drop rates, and other pertinent details.
  • Dialogue trees: All of the choice-based dialogue and actions made in the game are outlined to help you form bonds with characters based on your personal preferences.
  • Appendices: For those who want true 100% completion, this section contains the full Memorandum, has New Game+ details, an achievements and trophies guide, and a build guide to help you be as prepared as possible for Metaphor's toughest challenges.

It also comes with a poster-sized map of Euchronia that's an exact replica of the in-game map.

From Software Strategy Guides

Future's Books of Knowledge series has proven to be incredibly popular. The first two volumes have been sold out for many months, but Amazon finally received more copies from a fresh print run. Volume 3, which released in October, covers the huge Shadow of the Erdtree DLC.

Future also re-released its popular Bloodborne guides in October as one 744-page tome covering the base game and DLC. In April, the Dark Souls Trilogy Compendium was reprinted to celebrate Future's 25th anniversary. Unfortunately, this one is currently sold out at major retailers. Future's Armored Core 6 Pilot's Manual is a very useful resource for the newest Armored Core game, which is arguably more complex than any Souls game or Elden Ring.

  • Elden Ring Official Strategy Guide Vol. 1: The Lands Between (Hardcover) -- $45 ($50)
  • Elden Ring Official Strategy Guide Vol. 2: Shards of the Shattering (Hardcover) -- $50
  • Elden Ring Official Strategy Guide Vol. 3: Shadow of the Erdtree (Hardcover) -- $40.49 ($45)
  • Bloodborne Complete Guide Anniversary Edition (Hardcover) -- $54 ($60)
  • Armored Core VI Pilot's Manual (Hardcover) -- $45
  • Dark Souls Trilogy Compendium Anniversary Edition (Hardcover) -- Sold out

Though not published by Future, it's worth mentioning that there's another very exciting book release slated for 2025. Metroid Prime 1-3: A Visual Retrospective is available to preorder for $45 (was $50) at Amazon. This hardcover book is being made by Piggyback, the publisher of the superb Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom guides.

  • Metroid Prime 1-3: A Visual Retrospective (Hardcover) -- $45 ($50) | Preorder, Releases 2025
  • Zelda Breath of the Wild Expanded Guide (Hardcover) -- $20 ($40)
  • Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Guide (Paperback) -- $18.74 ($30)
  • Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Collector's Edition Guide (Hardcover) -- $40.49 ($45)

item.title: Helldivers 2 Players Crush Illuminate Invaders In Under A Week
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/helldivers-2-players-crush-illuminate-invaders-in-under-a-week/1100-6528505/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

During The Game Awards, Arrowhead Game Studios unleashed a new Helldivers 2 update that introduced the Illuminate, an alien race that was thought to be extinct. In-universe, the Illuminate had over a century to make their plans to invade Super Earth, but the players have already repelled the invasion in just under a week.

As reported by PC Gamer, over 100,000 players checked in with Helldivers 2 over a 24-hour period, the game's highest numbers since April. And the combined forces expelled the Illuminate so thoroughly that this previously feared foe is now the subject of mockery by the triumphant players.

The same account noted that the fight against the Illuminate at Calypso was also one of the bloodiest battles in the game's history.

As this meme points out, the victory over the Illuminate came by a very thin margin, and only because so many players were active. A second wave of the invasion may be a different story, especially if the players can't marshal all of their forces.

Earlier this year, Arrowhead mapped out a 60-day plan to fix some of Helldivers 2's lingering issues, many of which were addressed in a patch that dropped in September. And while a story mode isn't in the cards, Helldivers 2 became one of the fastest-selling PlayStation games of all time, as well as one of GameSpot's picks for the Best Games of 2024.

item.title: Capcom "Focusing" On Reviving Other Franchises After Okami 2 And New Onimusha Reveals
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/capcom-focusing-on-reviving-other-franchises-after-okami-2-and-new-onimusha-reveals/1100-6528504/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The 2000s called, and Capcom answered last week by unveiling new entries in the Okami and Onimusha series. But the company doesn't seem done yet with bringing back old franchises. In fact, Capcom states it's "focusing on reactivating dormant IPs" alongside brand-new titles going forward.

A Capcom press release highlighting the reveals of Okami 2 and Onimusha Way of the Sword at The Game Awards offers insight into the publisher's plans for the future. "In addition to regularly releasing major new titles each year, Capcom is focusing on reactivating dormant IPs that haven't had a new title launch recently. The company is working to further enhance corporate value by leveraging its rich library of content, which includes reviving past IPs like [Okami 2 and Onimusha Way of the Sword], in order to continuously produce highly efficient, high-quality titles."

Okami 2--referred as "Okami sequel project" by Capcom--will see the return of the original's director, with Hideki Kamiya. Okami originally launched for PS2 in 2006, and the series did get a follow-up in 2010 (2011 for North America) with Okamiden for Nintendo DS. There is no release window for the Okami sequel project.

Meanwhile, Ominusha Way of the Sword is set to arrive in 2026 on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S. It's the first new entry in the mainline series since 2006's Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams for PS2.

It's not necessarily new for Capcom to note that it's looking into old franchises to revisit, by the way. In 2019, Capcom discussed intentions to "utilize" dormant franchises. In addition, earlier this year, the company insisted Mega Man hasn't been forgotten, meaning the Blue Bomber could possibly see a return alongside Okami in the years ahead.
